1916

24 January, 1910.

ir, Sung Sing Kwan 
39 Peterboro åt.

Boston, Mass.

My dear Kwan:

Don'y apologize.

I frequently get caught in the same compli -
cations which make necessary sudden and late changes of plans. We shall

get you out here yet; never fear.

I think you know porhers better than I do the things that need

to be ingressad on our good friona Tomy. Tell him to get dom to business

and remember that borhood days are ever and it's time for him to show him

self the man. Hako clear to him also, in caso ho more than his parents may 
be to blame for the Financial situation, that it is poor policy to carry a 
loan if he can possibly avoia it; for the interest charges have to be met 
steadily, and in the end thoy stand, of course, 2 a doad loss.

I hope I shall see you un hore before February 10th, or perhaps 
botter noot you in Boston. I have been thinking of giving the Chinese boya 
here a little surprise at the time of the coming Chinese new year; and I was 
anxious to have that surpruse take the form of some kind of a Chinese meal 
at my house. In order to carry the thing out I have got to have some exert 
advice as to the character of the dishes and how thay can be provided, and 
this advice I was hoping to get from you. If your examinations are over by 
the 5th, there will doubtless be time for me to get hold of you between that 
date and to 10th -

Wishing you every Success on the exams, belleve e as always

Faithfully yours,

metadata.abstract: Letter advising that Tommy (Lee) should be told to get down to business. Stearns is also thinking about hosting a Chinese meal at his house for the students and asking Kwan's advice on the menu.
